metadata.TITLE: Catch Up On The Latest News Clips - ITVX
metadata.DESC: Discover the latest and breaking news clips from ITV. ITVX - The UK's freshest streaming service.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: The latest ITV News headlines - as NatWest boss apologises to Nigel Farage
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Watch a short summary of today's top stories from the ITV News team.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Consultant doctors strike for the first time in more than a decade
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Consultant doctors and hospital-based dentists have begun a two-day strike in England. NHS bosses have warned planned care will come to a "virtual standstill".

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Mortgage rates fall for the first time in two months
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Both two and five-year fixed rates mortgages became slightly cheaper. It follows better than expected inflation figures announced yesterday.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: 20,000 RMT members walk out in latest rail strike at start of school holidays
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Members of the RMT union at 14 rail companies are walking out until Sunday. And members of ASLEF are refusing to work overtime.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Temperatures in America's Death Valley continue to soar after one tourist dies
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Temperatures in Death Valley, in California have soared higher than 50C in recent days as the world struggles with record-breaking heat.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: New Zealand wins opening World Cup match hours after deadly shooting
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: The shooting saw silences held before kick off in the opening games, in which both host nations won their matches.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: What's the story behind Nigel Farage and his bank account closure?
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: The prestigious bank, Coutts, closed the former Brexit party leader's account with them earlier this year, prompting backlash from MPs and even the PM.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: The journey of women's football: From outright ban to record Women's World Cup
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: After their memorable win at the Euros last year, England's Lionesses have become household names - but the journey to get there hasn't been an easy one.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: ITV News survey finds anti-Muslim hate crimes have doubled to a record high
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Organisation 'Tell Mama' and ITV News carried out a survey of 117 mosques, finding 90% had been subjected to hate crimes, including physical violence.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Huge police operation as authorities hunt 'escaped lion' in Berlin
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Police were alerted to the animal just outside Berlin's city limits by people reporting that they had seen what appeared to be a big cat .

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: How difficult is it to travel on holiday sustainably?
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Greenpeace are calling on the government to ban short-haul flights as southern Europe feels the scorching impact of climate change.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Sunny spells and scattered showers: The latest ITV Weather
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Watch the latest UK forecast from the ITV Weather team.

longformData.title: Tonight
longformData.description: Compelling current affairs stories that get to the heart of what matters

longformData.title: ITV Evening News
longformData.description: All the latest news from the ITV Evening News team

longformData.title: Good Morning Britain
longformData.description: BAFTA-nominated breakfast show covering the latest news, sport & weather

longformData.title: ITV News at Ten
longformData.description: The latest news from ITV News at Ten.

longformData.title: King Charles III: The Coronation
longformData.description: History in the making - relive the day in full

longformData.title: Peston
longformData.description: ITV News' Robert Peston presents his lively political interview programme

longformData.title: 60 Minutes: Prince Harry Interview
longformData.description: Prince Harry sits down with Anderson Cooper from CBS' 60 Minutes

longformData.title: Highlights
longformData.description: A moment in history - watch highlights from an unforgettable day

longformData.title: The Clinic
longformData.description: Timely documentary about the history of a controversial NHS unit

longformData.title: Thur 13 July 6am
longformData.description: As Huw Edwards is named in the BBC crisis, Jon Sopel discusses the latest developments.

clips.episodeTitle: Protests as controversial barge to house asylum seekers docks in Portland
clips.synopsis: The Bibby Stockholm barge, that will be used to house more than 500 asylum seekers, has docked in Dorset - to scenes of protesters with very different opinions.

clips.episodeTitle: Rail ticket office closures: Andy Burnham leading a legal challenge
clips.synopsis: Five Labour mayors are joining forces to challenge plans to close up to 1,000 rail ticket offices in England and say a consultation period was not long enough.

clips.episodeTitle: Prime Minister to cap student numbers on 'poor quality' university degrees
clips.synopsis: The government has said limits may be imposed on courses that have high dropout rates or that lead to a low proportion of graduates getting a professional job.

clips.episodeTitle: Government set to break promise of forty new hospitals by 2030
clips.synopsis: The government is set to finish only 32 of its promised new 40 hospitals by 2030, according to the spending watchdog.

clips.episodeTitle: Ministers face nurses' wrath about getting lower public sector pay award
clips.synopsis: The nurses' union has written to the Health Secretary about their 5 percent pay rise, agreed before higher deals were confirmed for other public sector workers.

clips.episodeTitle: Mortgage pain as warnings monthly payments could rise up to £500
clips.synopsis: The Bank of England has warned that nearly a million mortgage holders could see their monthly repayments increase by around £500 over the next three years.

clips.episodeTitle: Thames Water boss says water bills will have to rise next year
clips.synopsis: The new interim boss of Thames Water has told MPs that water bills will have to increase in order to fund 'substantial' investment in the sector.

clips.episodeTitle: ITV News' Political Editor on wages, interest rates and what could happen next
clips.synopsis: Mortgage rates have risen on the back of the Bank of England's interest rate hikes, as monetary policymakers attempt to tackle rampant inflation.

clips.episodeTitle: Wages rose by a record 7.3% in year to May in fresh blow to Bank of England
clips.synopsis: Wages in the UK  have risen at a record annual pace, fuelling fears that inflation will stay high for longer.

clips.episodeTitle: U.S. President Joe Biden's trip to UK glosses over tensions on other topics
clips.synopsis: Downing Street said Mr Sunak discussed the United States' controversial decision to send cluster munitions to Kyiv, hours before Mr Biden met King Charles.

clips.episodeTitle: Sunak on collision course with ministers over 'short-sighted' public sector pay rises
clips.synopsis: The Prime Minister is under pressure from his own cabinet to accept the recommendations of pay review bodies, but he insists they must be 'affordable'.

clips.episodeTitle: Internal government row over whether to award teachers 6.5% pay rise
clips.synopsis: ITV News understands there is division between the Education Secretary and Treasury over whether teachers should be given the recommended pay increase.

clips.episodeTitle: Wildfires continue in Greece as southern Europe gripped by heatwave
clips.synopsis: As the Cerberus heatwave continues, hospitals in Italy say they have seen a rise in people seeking emergency care for heat-related illnesses.

clips.episodeTitle: Las Vegas police issue search warrant in Tupac Shakur 1996 killing
clips.synopsis: Shakur died after after being shot several times inside a black vehicle stopped near the Las Vegas strip

clips.episodeTitle: Trump says he expects to be arrested as part of investigation into Capitol riots
clips.synopsis: The former U.S. president posted on his Truth Social platform that he's received a letter explaining he's a target of the Justice Department's investigation.

clips.episodeTitle: Australian state of Victoria pulls out of hosting the 2026 Commonwealth Games
clips.synopsis: The Premier of Victoria Daniel Andrews said he could not justify the '12 day sporting event', after the estimated cost almost tripled.

clips.episodeTitle: Wildfires continue to burn in Greece as heat threatens people's health
clips.synopsis: The UN's weather agency says the soaring temperatures in Europe could last for weeks. Twenty alerts are in place in Italy and fires are burning in Switzerland.

clips.episodeTitle: Two people killed in 'emergency' on bridge linking Crimea to Russia
clips.synopsis: The governor of Russia's Belgorod region has said a man and a woman died, with their daughter also injured. Locals had reported hearing explosions.

clips.episodeTitle: Why Hollywood could grind to a halt as actors join writers for strikes
clips.synopsis: Hollywood's actors' union will join writers on the picket line, potentially causing disruptions across the world and here in the UK.

clips.episodeTitle: Damning report on UK government's response to Chinese espionage
clips.synopsis: Successive governments have failed to grasp and respond to the scale of the threat posed by China, Parliament's spy agency watchdog has found.

clips.episodeTitle: NATO agree Ukraine support package as Zelenskyy warned to show 'gratitude'
clips.synopsis: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has moved to smooth tensions after Defence Secretary Ben Wallace made comments about Ukraine's request for weapons.

clips.episodeTitle: Temperatures in the Mediterranean could set a European record
clips.synopsis: Tourists are being warned to prepare as a heatwave suffocates parts of Europe. Temperatures are predicted to reach highs of up to 48 celsius in part of Italy.

clips.episodeTitle: Aretha Franklin note that was found under her sofa is legal will, jury rules
clips.synopsis: The verdict comes after a four-year dispute within Ms Franklin’s family to determine the late musician's intention for her estate.

clips.episodeTitle: NATO agree Ukraine support package as Zelenskyy warned to show 'gratitude'
clips.synopsis: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has moved to smooth tensions after Defence Secretary Ben Wallace made comments about Ukraine's request for weapons.

clips.episodeTitle: India, Japan and U.S. hit by floods as global sea temperatures hit record high
clips.synopsis: Extreme rainfall has caused deadly flooding across the globe, triggered by rising sea temperatures. Experts have called it an 'unprecedented peak'.

clips.episodeTitle: Rita Ora on taking back her music and changing attitudes towards refugees
clips.synopsis: The singer-songwriter - who was born in Kosovo to Albanian parents - says there needs to be more focus on the positives immigration brings to Britain.

clips.episodeTitle: Traditional Chinese Medicine: Why are some people skeptical?
clips.synopsis: Dating back two thousand years traditional Chinese medicine is proving more and more popular, but concerns over a lack of scientific evidence are growing.

clips.episodeTitle: Calls for Monkey Dust to be made a Class A drug - but what is it?
clips.synopsis: The drug is being linked to violence and unpredictable behaviour, piling pressure on emergency services, and one of the worst areas is Stoke-on-Trent.

clips.episodeTitle: Almost half of English hospitals forced to temporarily close services due to disrepair
clips.synopsis: ITV News has found that some buildings are so structurally unsafe that entire departments - including A&E and maternity units - have had to shut for good.

clips.episodeTitle: Sobering warning issued about the hidden dangers of Ketamine drug
clips.synopsis: A drugs recovery centre in Wales has told ITV News there has been an increase in young people being admitted with bladder failure after taking the drug.

clips.episodeTitle: Family of Olivia Pratt-Korbel backing petition to make killers face victims
clips.synopsis: The family of murdered schoolgirl Olivia Pratt-Korbel are petitioning to make killers attend sentencing hearings, after Thomas Cashman chose not to attend his.

clips.episodeTitle: 'You never get closure': Olivia Pratt-Korbel's mum calls for change to sentencing rules
clips.synopsis: In her first TV interview, Cheryl Korbel said she wants a change in the law to force criminals to face victims' families when they are sentenced.

clips.episodeTitle: Boom in holiday homes forcing locals out of tourist hotspots
clips.synopsis: An ITV News investigation has found that in some areas the number of Air BnB lets has increased by 76% since the pandemic.

clips.episodeTitle: Extreme and protracted drought threatens way of life in southern Spain
clips.synopsis: Campaigners have warned that the way products like mangoes and avocadoes are farmed - many of them for export to the UK - will have to change.

clips.episodeTitle: How is Western military support bolstering Ukraine's counteroffensive?
clips.synopsis: John Irvine visited Ukrainian soldiers last year, as they called for greater support. He's now returned to the same unit to see the impact Western aid has had.

clips.episodeTitle: Increased pressure to ban puppy yoga over animal welfare concerns
clips.synopsis: There are have been further calls to ban Puppy Yoga after an ITV News investigation into the growing trend.

clips.episodeTitle: The low rates of conviction for abuse in care homes, despite secret filming
clips.synopsis: ITV News research found that only 1.4% of care home abuse allegations made in England and Wales resulted in charges.

clips.episodeTitle: Wagner Group was close to agreeing lucrative deal with President Bashar al-Assad
clips.synopsis: In an exclusive report, ITV News' Security Editor Rohit Kachroo uncovers negotiations that were taking place between the Russian group and the Syrian president.

clips.episodeTitle: Women's World Cup: Teams to watch, Lionesses to look out for and that pay controversy
clips.synopsis: ITV News' Sports Editor Steve Scott with his best predictions on the players and teams who could steal the limelight at the Women's World Cup.

clips.episodeTitle: What does the heatwave in Europe mean for UK travellers going to 'hot spots'?
clips.synopsis: Record-breaking heat has been forecast around the world this week. So what can you do to protect yourself? And what are your rights as a consumer?

clips.episodeTitle: Hollywood strikes: Why are people walking out and what do they want?
clips.synopsis: Hollywood actors have gone on strike, bringing TV and film productions to a halt. But why, in an industry of wealth and glamour, are they taking action?

clips.episodeTitle: Security scares and a 'forgotten passcode': What's going on with Boris Johnson's phone?
clips.synopsis: Why the former Prime Minister's old iPhone is back in the news, just a week after the High Court ruled that his messages must be handed to the Covid inquiry.

clips.episodeTitle: Which airports have hiked up drop-off charges, and how can you avoid them?
clips.synopsis: More than a third of major UK airports have increased their 'kiss and fly' fees for drivers dropping people off near departure areas, according to the RAC.

clips.episodeTitle: Lucy Letby trial: What is the nurse accused of and what has been the key evidence?
clips.synopsis: The jury's begun deliberating in the trial of Lucy Letby, charged with the murders of seven babies and attempted murders of ten others. She denies all charges.

clips.episodeTitle: BBC presenter allegations: The corporation lays out its timeline of events
clips.synopsis: With claims and counter-claims about the behaviour of a BBC presenter being discussed, here is what we know so far from the BBC.

clips.episodeTitle: Summer travel chaos: What do looming air traffic control strikes mean for people hoping to get away?
clips.synopsis: Travel expert Paul Charles on how to cover yourself this summer as air traffic control staff threaten to cause major disruption to flights across the continent.

clips.episodeTitle: How to protect against skin cancer, as cases hit a record high
clips.synopsis: The number of serious skin cancer cases among the over-55s has gone up by 195% since the 1990s, so what can we do to prevent it?

clips.episodeTitle: Survey reveals that over a quarter of Brits have never boiled an egg
clips.synopsis: A survey of 4,000 adults found a higher number of people than might be expected are not comfortable with simple culinary skills.

clips.episodeTitle: Forest Green Rovers men's manager joins list of female trailblazers
clips.synopsis: As Hannah Dingley is appointed caretaker manager of Forest Green Rovers men's team, we look at the other woman who reached new heights in their field.

clips.episodeTitle: 75 years of the NHS: A look back at its trials and triumphs
clips.synopsis: Since its launch in 1948 the NHS has touched the lives of millions, with over half the population saying it's what makes them most proud to be British.

clips.episodeTitle: Wendy's fast food restaurant changes sign after schoolgirl spots mistake
clips.synopsis: Nepheli, a pupil at Hayes Park School in Uxbridge, wrote to the restaurant after she noticed the apostrophe in 'Wendy's' was missing.

clips.episodeTitle: Looking for Summer bike ride inspiration? Cycling the Viking Coastal trail
clips.synopsis: More people are being encouraged to cycle rather than drive. Summer, then, is the perfect time to dust off your bike and discover the best routes.

clips.episodeTitle: Community comes together to harvest huge lavender field
clips.synopsis: Julia Dimmock has 5,000 lavender bushes at Finchingfield in Essex. This year the crop is so good that she's asked for local volunteers to help her get it in.

clips.episodeTitle: Breakthrough in Ash Dieback research could provide answers to UK's biggest tree disease
clips.synopsis: Thousands of trees have been cut down due to Ash Dieback, with predictions 160 million could be lost across the country. Now a breakthrough could provide hope.

clips.episodeTitle: Prince and Princess of Wales make family outing to the Royal Air Tattoo
clips.synopsis: The royal couple took all three of the children to the event at RAF Fairford in Gloucestershire, where they met officials and toured aircraft.

clips.episodeTitle: Police given bravery award for heroic attempt to save boys in Solihull lake incident
clips.synopsis: Police officers used their batons and fists to break the ice to try to save the children. An inquest found the incident was an 'awful, terrible accident'.

clips.episodeTitle: 'Adopt a Grandparent' bringing together the young and the old
clips.synopsis: 200,000 older people haven't had a conversation with a friend or relative in over a month, a sad reality which inspired one care home resident to try and help.

clips.episodeTitle: Why a photographer from Bath has been snapping selfies at the barbers for half a century
clips.synopsis: Sam Farr has been capturing 'mirror portraits' with his hairdresser Joe for the past five decades, but there's more to it for him than just a fresh cut.

clips.episodeTitle: Why aren't tourists heading to Wales in the same numbers as elsewhere in the UK?
clips.synopsis: Wales' tourism board say the country is "like no other", with its rich history and proud culture, but transport links are being blamed for putting visitors off.

clips.episodeTitle: Save the swifts: Calls to build a better future for Britain's birdlife in our housing
clips.synopsis: Campaigners are calling for it to be compulsory for all new-build houses to make room for nests of swifts following a decline in the species.

clips.episodeTitle: Could a player from Northern Ireland make it to centre court at Wimbledon?
clips.synopsis: This year marks the 136th Wimbledon Championship but only one Belfast player has served her way to the competition to date.

clips.episodeTitle: Hundreds waiting to board the Boeing 737 converted to a Hampshire holiday let
clips.synopsis: There is a two-year wait for holidaymakers to spend a night in a 1960s aircraft in entrepreneur Steven Northam's back garden near Winchester.

clips.episodeTitle: Abseils and German paint: The challenges of keeping the Westbury White Horse gleaming
clips.synopsis: Specialist cleaners have descended on the iconic Wiltshire landmark for an eight-week spring clean, with a number of logistical hurdles along the way.
